questions.question_text: In which mode does the Cisco Expressway act as a SIP-H.323 gateway only if one or more of the endpoints are locally registered?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
In "registered only" mode, the Cisco Expressway acts as a SIP-H.323 gateway only when at least one of the endpoints involved in the call is locally registered to the Expressway. This mode is used to restrict the gateway functionality to locally registered devices, ensuring tighter control over call routing and usage.

questions.question_text: Between which two DTMF relay methods does the Expressway support interworking? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
B&E: When the Expressway is interworking a call between SIP and H.323, it also interworks the DTMF signaling, but only between RFC 2833 DTMF, and the H.245 user input indicators "dtmf" and "basicString".

Source: https://jerome.pro:8443/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/admin_guide/Cisco-Expressway-Administrator-Guide-X12-5.pdf

Selected Answer: BE
Interworking DTMF signals
 
 For SIP calls, the Expressway implements RFC 2833 for DTMF signaling in RTP payloads. 
 
 For H.323 calls, the Expressway implements H.245 UserInputIndication for DTMF signaling. dtmf is the only supported UserInputCapability. Expressway does not support any other H.245 user input capabilities (eg. basicString, generalString) 
 
 When the Expressway is interworking a call between SIP and H.323, it also interworks the DTMF signaling, but only between RFC 2833 DTMF, and the H.245 user input indicators “dtmf” and “basicString”.
 
 https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/admin_guide/X14-0-2/exwy_b_cisco-expressway-administrator-guide-x1402.pdf

questions.question_text: When does the Webex App Endpoint send media to the Video Mesh cluster during a meeting?

choices.D: when there is insufficient bandwidth at the internet edge
choices.B: when there is insufficient bandwidth at the MPLS WAN edge.
choices.C: when the round-trip delay to the Video Mesh cluster is shorter than the round-trip delay to the Webex cloud media services
choices.A: when the Webex cloud media services are offline

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer C: The Webex App Endpoint will send media to the Video Mesh cluster instead of Webex cloud media services in situations where the connection to the Video Mesh cluster is more efficient, typically based on factors like round-trip delay. The decision is based on ensuring the best media quality and minimizing latency during a meeting.

Round-trip delay is a key factor for the Webex App to determine the most optimal media path. If the delay to the local Video Mesh cluster is lower (more optimal) than the delay to the Webex cloud media services, the Webex App will route the media through the Video Mesh cluster to improve the call quality and reduce latency.

Selected Answer: A
Correct Answer:
A. The HTTP Allow List must be manual or use Automatic inbound rules updated to include all Cisco IM and Presence servers.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/config_guide/X12-6/exwy_b_mra-expressway-deployment-guide/exwy_b_mra-expressway-deployment-guide_chapter_01000.html#reference_603D5CF5FB76E8635F2D7C840C81B810

Selected Answer: A
Advanced file transfer in Cisco Jabber over Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) requires communication between Cisco Jabber clients and the Cisco IM and Presence (IM&P) servers. Cisco Expressway-C must be configured to allow HTTP traffic from Cisco Jabber to the IM&P servers.

To enable this:

HTTP Allow List on Expressway-C must be configured to include all IM&P servers.
The list can be updated either manually or automatically (using the "Automatic inbound rules" setting).

Selected Answer: A
AFT feature
For the AFT feature to work across Expressway, make sure that all Unified CM IM and Presence Service nodes are on the allow list, whether manually or automatically added.

Automatic Inbound Rules
Edit the HTTP Allow List
Upload Rules to the HTTP Allow List

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/config_guide/X12-5/exwy_b_mra-expressway-deployment-guide/exwy_b_mra-expressway-deployment-guide_chapter_01000.html#task_FED878914C77C914B5FD7C7108F5CDCE

choices.A: The HTTP Allow List must be manual or use Automatic inbound rules updated to include all Cisco IM and Presence servers.
choices.B: The HTTPS Allow List must be manual or use Automatic inbound rules updated to include all Cisco IM and Presence servers.
choices.D: The HTTP Allow List must use Automatic update rules to include all Cisco IM and Presence servers.
choices.C: The HTTP Allow List must use Automatic update rules to include all Cisco UCM servers.

questions.question_text: In a larger Cisco Collaboration deployment, a user requires the advanced file transfer function in Cisco Jabber while the client is using Mobile and Remote Access. The deployment has multiple Expressway clusters and internal Cisco UCM clusters. Which configuration must be applied on Cisco Expressway-C for this function to be available?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which SIP trunk security profile configuration on the Cisco UCM server is used for a secured SIP trunk to an Expressway server that is already integrated with the Cisco UCM for Mobile and Remote Access?

choices.C:
Device Security Mode: Non-Secure
Incoming Transport Type: TCP+UDP

Outgoing Transport Type: TCP -
Incoming Port*: 5060
choices.A:
Device Security Mode: Encrypted -

Incoming Transport Type: TLS -

Outgoing Transport Type: TLS -
Incoming Port*: 5061
choices.D:
Device Security Mode: Authenticated

Incoming Transport Type: TLS -

Outgoing Transport Type: TLS -
Incoming Port*: 6061
choices.B:
Device Security Mode: Encrypted -

Incoming Transport Type: TLS -

Outgoing Transport Type: TLS -
Incoming Port*: 6061

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A and C are wrong, per the MRA deployment guide you should "configure the Incoming Port to be different from the Line ports", the line ports being 5060 and 5061.
That leaves B and D. B is the better option because it has Device Security Mode set to Encrypted which secures the media.
